WorkItem.Description:
The rawr and in-game hit percentages are different. Rawr reports my current hit change at +16.35%, and WoW says +16.97%
 
This leads to incorrect builds in the optimizer as I end up with more +hit than necessary.
 
4.0.16.0b client
v0.62 add-on
 
Arcane mage, yadda yadda, Character export:

WorkItem.Summary: Mage hit percentage calculation different than in-game

Comments.Message: Armory also reports 16.35% hit. Are you sure you are wearing same in game as on armory? http://us.battle.net/wow/en/character/earthen-ring/flanderflew/advanced
Please attach the character file, not paste the text in.
Hrm, Armory doesn't match what it says in game either... :(

Ah, it looks like rawr and the armory do not see the bonuses coming from the belt, "Soul Breath Belt", 704 armor, yellow socket, added socket, socket bonus +10 int, 380 stam, 232 int, 96 crit, 160 haste, +60 hit (reforge). It shows the gems, but not the bonuses.

The problem with the Soul Breath Belt is that we have no way of properly parsing the item. This is due to the fact that it has a "Random Enchant" associated with it. These are not properly giving value by Blizzard for us to evaluate them. Once they give us something to work with, then we can help, but until then the only way for you to evaluate the item is to manually add in the item and edit the stats for it.
Yes, this seems the same as http://rawr.codeplex.com/workitem/19490
